pros:
- Beautiful boat ride and a very different vibe from working in the city.
- Some staff and members are very friendly. 
- Great place to  gather experience and for short term employment.
cons:
Good amount of members at this club treat you like a servant and is stuck in the 1900's, sexist and racist.
Good amount of staff have been there for over 20 years and many do not accept change very well. They are also very stuck in their old ways and thinking. 
Due to this sort of setup and personal mix, any sort of change is not supported, but instead there are a lot of negativity and drama. Traditions and old ways are not always bad, but not being able to see the bigger picture and not working as a team is the biggest downfall of this club and especially the Food & Beverage department. This department makes the most money apart from Membership, but is always the first to be blamed and is also underpaying their staff. 
For years staff are making the bare minimum, students are expected to perform at a very high level with zero experience. 
Sexism and tying into unfair wages/promotions is also very common. Male staff are often paid a lot higher and offered promotions automatically while there's been many cases that female staff are always not good enough, even though their work ethics is much better. 
Some of the Senior management staff in the department are very rude, respect is to be earned and not expected. 
Very glad I am not under this toxic work environment anymore. 
There was absolute zero work/life balance and regards to your level of sanity.
Almost forgot to mention, Board Members' involvement with the department is way overboard and they get too much 'Special Treatment' because management is busy making them happy than the overall well-being of the club/department. 
The culture here is only strong towards the tradition, but staff culture is non-existent.

pros: Fantastic summer job, working with great students and at a beautiful club
cons: Nothing bad to say about working here
